title: Curry-dusted Shrimp With Slaw
summary: Curry-dusted Shrimp With Slaw is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 1 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 11g of protein, 9g of fat, and a total of 256 calories. For $2.49 per serving, this recipe covers 36% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. If you have asian fish sauce, carrot, sugar, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 6 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is awesome. Try Cornmeal-Dusted Catfish Sandwiches with Tangy Slaw, TGIF Part 2: Curry-Dusted Tilapia with Caramelized Onions & Sweet Pea Puree, and Cumin-Dusted Shrimp Sandwiches for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.
